update.description:
Currently we use separate world files to specify the physics engine, but this is a synchronization problem we shouldn't have to deal with. This pull request allows the physics engine specified in a world file to be over-ridden by a command-line parameter.

For example, `gazebo -e bullet` will open the default empty world with the bullet engine. `gazebo -e bullet sdf/worlds/double_pendulums.world`.

The ability to over-ride the physics engine was added to ServerFixture as well, so that we don't need to maintain duplicate world files for testing the physics engines.

Fixes issue #486.

UPDATE:
Added GetType() method to PhysicsEngine and verify that proper physics engine type is loaded in regression tests.

Refactor Server::LoadFile according to Nate's suggestion.
update.title: Fix for #486: Specify physics engine on command line

pullrequest.title: Fix for #486: Specify physics engine on command line

content.html:
I know you didn't modify this code, but this is a bug that caught me yesterday. The bracket operator on a std::map will insert an instance of _classname if it doesn't exist. This could in turn mess up the IsRegistered function. It's not likely, but it's better to do:

std::map<std::string, PhysicsFactoryFn>::iterator iter = engines.find(_classname);
if (iter != engines.end())
    result = (iter->second)(_world);

pullrequest.title: Fix for #486: Specify physics engine on command line

content.raw: Ok, I've added an PhysicsFactory::IsRegistered(std::string) and moved things around so that the IsRegistered check is called after physics::load(), which is where the physics engines are registered.
content.html: Ok, I've added an PhysicsFactory::IsRegistered(std::string) and moved things around so that the IsRegistered check is called after physics::load(), which is where the physics engines are registered.

content.raw:
If an invalid physics engine type is passed in, gazebo should use the current default (such as ODE) and output a error.

Example case:

    gzserver -e test
content.html:
If an invalid physics engine type is passed in, gazebo should use the current default (such as ODE) and output a error.

Example case:

content.html:
With the new LoadFile, this could become

std::string physics;
if (this->vm.count("physics"))
    physics = this->vm["physics"].as<std::string>();

if (!this->LoadFile(configFilename, physics))
       return false;
